data.title: Classes and Staff Details — California Brazil Camp 2024
data.text:
Advanced Guitar

In the advanced guitar class, we will explore the universe of Brazilian music, including its influences, styles and trends, focusing particularly on (1) the guitar and its importance and role in this universe.

(2) the guitar vocabulary used in song and instrumental music today in Brazil, applying it to composition, comping and improvisation. read more>

chicopinheiro.com

Samba percussion and vocals, Int. Choro

Samba - Join us to sing and play samba in a large group context. Our class focuses on familiarity with repertoire, and we encourage every participant - vocalist or instrumentalist - to learn to sing all the sambas they perform. The repertoire is varied and includes rarely played older sambas from the "Terreiro" tradition and other classics of the samba repertoire. The repertoire will be made available before camp. Having some basic knowledge of how to play the instrument you bring is necessary. If you don't play any instruments, join us for singing!

Intermediate Choro - This workshop is dedicated to the group study and performance of Choro repertoire, exploring the Polka, Maxixe, Choro, and Choro Sambado, emphasizing style-specific levadas (comping) and rhythmic interpretation. These classes are aimed at students who are familiar with basic chords and comping and have some fluency in reading musical notation. We will explore the roles of soloists and accompanists within the context of a Regional-focused Choro Roda.

Cavaquinho, Intermediate Choro, and Samba

Intermediate Choro - This workshop is dedicated to the group study and performance of Choro repertoire, exploring the Polka, Maxixe, Choro, and Choro Sambado, emphasizing style-specific levadas (comping) and rhythmic interpretation. These classes are aimed at students who are familiar with basic chords and comping and have some fluency in reading musical notation. We will explore the roles of soloists and accompanists within the context of a Regional-focused Choro Roda.

Samba - Join us to sing and play samba in a large group context. Our class focuses on familiarity with repertoire, and we encourage every participant - vocalist or instrumentalist - to learn to sing all the sambas they perform. The repertoire is varied and includes rarely played older sambas from the "Terreiro" tradition and other classics of the samba repertoire. The repertoire will be

Dance - Gafieira

During our samba de gafieira classes, we will connect with the elements that constitute the core of the gafieira, the principles that precede thinking about samba as a couple, thus learning the reasons and sensations for which one chooses to move in that way in samba (with vibration, fluidity, liquidity) building bases to dialogue and connect with oneself, with others, and with the culture and history of samba. As we dance alone and as a couple, we will learn the basic elements that constitute the formal language of samba de gafieira but always with room for improvisation, as the dance is alive and is created by those who dance. All Levels including complete beginners welcome.

Bata Ketu / Percussion

Bata Ketu, a "Musical Interplay of Cuba and Brazil" is a project founded by Mark with Michael Spiro, with special participation by Jorge Alabê. All three will lead this class, focusing on the rhythms and songs from the cultures that shape so much of the music that Brazil Camp is about. For percussion and vocals. This class will focus on the relationship between Brazilian rhythms and other Afro-Centric music of the New World, particularly Afro-Cuban music. We will explore the relationship and commonalities between the folkloric and popular musics from both cultures, and see how they relate to and inform each other.

Drumset

We will cover the most common Brazilian rhythms on the drum set, such as samba, baião, ijexá, maracatu and more. We’ll talk about the concepts and technique necessary to play these rhythms on the drums with an authentic feel and swing.

We’ll also talk about the role of our instrument in different performing situations, and also my favorite exercises to help develop and master the feel and language used when we play Brazilian music on the drums.

Bata Ketu / Percussion

Bata Ketu, a "Musical Interplay of Cuba and Brazil" is a project founded by Michael with Mark Lamson, with special participation by Jorge Alabê. All three will lead this class, focusing on the rhythms and songs from the cultures that shape so much of the music that Brazil Camp is about. For percussion and vocals. This class will focus on the relationship between Brazilian rhythms and other Afro-Centric music of the New World, particularly Afro-Cuban music. We will explore the relationship and commonalities between the folkloric and popular musics from both cultures, and see how they relate to and inform each other.

Portuguese

I have been a Portuguese teacher for over thirty years. I understand that a language class has to be fun and relate to one's reality. This class integrates some grammar, language structure, and culture. It is about understanding the Brazilian life style, slang, and the language of the everyday life. We study a vocabulary that relates to what we do, and our lives and interests. A special attention is paid to pronunciation and consequently to the use of different muscles in the mouth.

We have students of different levels in the same class and everyone can benefit from it. Whenever possible, we work on songs and lyrics and whatever are the students' interests.

Vocal

Monica and Teco Cardoso (sax and flute) have prepared special classes for Brazil Camp for singers and wind players, exploring accents, divisions, dictions and articulations based on three Brazilian music styles SAMBA, BAIÃO and BOSSA NOVA.

Listening to examples, creating vocal patterns and grooves for the styles and soloing over the grooves to practice.

In the student performance we’ll perform songs from class, as well AMAZON RIVER by Dori Caymmi to be sung with students of the Big Band classes.

monicasalmaso.com

Yoga

There's nothing more delicious than a yoga practice early morning and out in nature. In yoga, we experience the power of our breath, the strength of our body and the peacefulness of our mind. Through a series of asanas (yoga postures) that are friendly to all levels, plus conscious breathing and deep relaxation, you will awaken to the most beautiful self you have ever experienced. patyrenda.com

Orixás dance movement and Silvestre Technique

SILVESTRE TECHNIQUE, native to Salvador, Bahia, is a continuously evolving contemporary dance technique with the objective of conditioning the dancer through physical and expressive training regardless of level or prior training. Classes are accompanied by live music to further awaken expression and inspiration. All levels are welcomed and encouraged.

ORIXÅ DANCE MOVEMENT examines and interprets symbols, gestures and movements derived from Yoruba deities. We will be learning traditional dances/ movements as we identify their specific energies/traits in relation to the 4 elements :Earth, Water, Air, and Fire. silvestretraining.com

Beginning Guitar

Week 2 Beginning Guitar will cover basic techniques for fingerstyle and pickstyle guitar as needed, as well as a handful of songs in the bossa nova, samba and forró genres. Accompaniment of songs with vocals will be the primary focus; singers wishing to sing are welcome. Guitarists with questions as to improvisation, choro guitar language, expanding their knowledge are welcome. Acoustic guitars are ideal. If you have an electric guitar you may need to bring a battery powered amp. Beginning cavaquinho/mandolin/uke players also welcome to join. Check back for charts/lyrics to download prior to camp. This class is best for students that have at least 1 year experience with guitar but wish to improve their skills and knowledge of Brazilian guitar.

Pandeiro -Special one-day workshop!

It is with great pleasure that we announce a special tribute to a long time member of Camp -- CARLINHOS PANDEIRO DE OURO. Since the early days of Camp, Carlinhos has brought the spirit of Brazil through his Pandeiro de Ouro.

He will be doing a special one day pandeiro workshop, and leading a discussion of his life as a 50 year member of Mangueira Samba School.

Pandeiro

In this beginners class, you will learn the basic pandeiro technique that will allow you to play any rhythms you want, including choro, samba, baião, capoeira. It best suits those who have never played pandeiro before.

Advanced class: This class is dedicated to expanding ways to play Brazilian rhythms on the pandeiro. We will cover the most important basic patterns, and add variations and ways to improvise on each rhythm including, choro, samba, maxixe, baião, xôte, côco, maracatu, and ijexá. claricecast.com

Vocal

Vocal Lab : Waking the Brazilian Voice

Using vocal technique exercises and the whole body for self expression, Brazilian songs and inspiring stories, we will create spontaneous harmonies, and deepen our experiences by adapting melodies to various feels of Brazilian rhythms, sing mouth batucada, improvise and more!

Repertoire : Brazilian Songbook 1

We will do voice warm ups, then sing together a few of the most beloved popular songs from various Brazilian composers that aspiring singers should know! We will also choose one or two pieces and create an arrangement that all students will be included and will have a part in, be it as a solo or in harmony.

Samba and Brasilian Percussion

Mestre Curtis Pierre is one the directors and founders of one of the first educational institutions of Brasilian culture in the United States since 1989. He will feature a special class on cuica, one of the most difficult and intriguing instruments of the Escola de Sambas. The cuica is a very versatile instrument, It can be tuned to any pitch. You will learn techniques on some of the most important points of playing the Cuica.

1. How to hold the cuica.

2. How to tune the cuica

3. How to play the cuica.

4. How it fits into the bateria

5. How to repair the cuica

6. How to play rhythms other than SAMBA and how it fits with contemporary music.

7. I will also include techniques and lessons on how all the samba instruments fit into the SAMBA

….and break them down individually. In addition, I’ll demonstrate techniques on other Brasilian percussion instruments like the berimbau.

Beginning Samba Dance

Whether you're a novice or have some dance experience, this class is designed to help you cultivate a solid foundation in samba. You'll delve into the musicality of the movements, engage in drills, and master the art of creating fluid combinations, all while fostering freedom of expression in your dance. We'll explore various styles of samba, enriching your understanding and appreciation of this vibrant dance form

Yoga

There's nothing more delicious than a yoga practice early morning and out in nature. In yoga, we experience the power of our breath, the strength of our body and the peacefulness of our mind. Through a series of asanas (yoga postures) that are friendly to all levels, plus conscious breathing and deep relaxation, you will awaken to the most beautiful self you have ever experienced.

Brazilian Jazz Ensemble - Spontaneous Morning Ensemble (All Levels) This class is aimed at all levels of musicianship. Reading is not necessary. Compositions and arrangements are created by Jovino in class with the available instruments and are learned by ear before being notated. Everyone who wants to can play, developing strong listening skills in the process.

The Music of João Donato (Int/Adv) - During this week at Brazil Camp, we will learn and play several of Donato’s compositions. I suggest that all participants familiarize themselves with his music by listening to the tunes prior to Camp. Charts (in concert, Bb and Eb versions) can be downloaded here.

Portuguese

I have been a Portuguese teacher for over thirty years. I understand that a language class has to be fun and relate to one's reality. This class integrates some grammar, language structure, and culture. It is about understanding the Brazilian life style, slang, and the language of the everyday life. We study a vocabulary that relates to what we do, and our lives and interests. A special attention is paid to pronunciation and consequently to the use of different muscles in the mouth.

We have students of different levels in the same class and everyone can benefit from it. Whenever possible, we work on songs and lyrics and whatever are the students' interests.

Samba de raiz song and vocals

Nilze is a singer, composer, cavaquinho and mandolin player with more than 40 years of experience, focusing on samba de raiz and choro styles. At Camp she will explore the repertoire of sambas from the beginning of the last century into the 2000’s. For beginning and intermediate cavaquinho players, and singers who want to delve into the beautiful melodies of Noel Rosa, Cartola, Dona Ivone Lara, Monarco, Nei Lopes, Paulinho da Viola and other masters.

Orixás dance movement and Silvestre Technique

SILVESTRE TECHNIQUE, native to Salvador, Bahia, is a continuously evolving contemporary dance technique with the objective of conditioning the dancer through physical and expressive training regardless of level or prior training. Classes are accompanied by live music to further awaken expression and inspiration. All levels are welcomed and encouraged.

ORIXÅ DANCE MOVEMENT examines and interprets symbols, gestures and movements derived from Yoruba deities. We will be learning traditional dances/ movements as we identify their specific energies/traits in relation to the 4 elements :Earth, Water, Air, and Fire. silvestretraining.com
